item.title: SQLite Is Dynamically Typed
item.description: A small, cool fact about SQLite is that its columns are flexibly typed. You can store any value in any column! Try it out: sqlite> create table t1 (v1 int, v2 varchar(10)); sqlite> insert into t1 values ("abc", "this string is longer than 10 characters!"); sqlite> select * from t1; abc|this string is longer than 10 characters! sqlite> select typeof(v1), typeof(v2) from t1; text|text The null type is still special:
item.author: (Zach Wener-Fligner)

item.title: Azure DevOps Services: Essentials – Git with Visual Studio and VS Code | Premier Developer
item.description: As development teams have evolved in their DevOps journey, we’re regularly asked to help with the transition to from TFVC to Git. Microsoft Unified and Premier Support offers a range of workshops covering all things DevOps. Among these is the Azure DevOps Services: Essentials – Git with Visual Studio workshop.

item.title: Harold Jackson N / A - Black Queer Living: A History of DIY Culture in the Black LBGT+ Community
item.description:
[w/ ASL Interpreting]
What is DIY culture? How does DIY culture intertwine with the Black LGBT+ culture? Get these questions answered, and learn a few easy beginner DIY tutorials to do on t-shirts! No previous experience required! --- Harold studied computer science at the University of Texas at Austin. He's started Black Queer Living, a youtube channel dedicated to teaching life skills 101, centering queer and trans* people of color: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCx3ihWKRcPrTDdhk87M2yeg
item.author: (JuneteenthConf)

item.title: On Methodology: Turing Laureates Discuss their Approach to Work
item.description: In this video from ACM's Celebration of 50 Years of the A.M. Turing Award, Turing Laureates Andrew Yao, Marvin Minsky, Herbert Simon, Shafi Goldwasser, James Gray, Edmund Clarke and Richard Karp discuss their approach to work and share advice for those who aspire to follow in their footsteps.
item.author: (Association for Computing Machinery (ACM))

item.title: Texas shatters voter registration records again as election draws closer
item.description: Texas now has 16.6 million voters, an increase of more than 400,000 since March. And since 2016, Texas has added 1.5 million voters to its rolls.

item.title: Toward a "modern" Emacs
item.description: It has only been a few months since the Emacs community went through an extended discussion on how to make the Emacs editor "popular again". As the community gears up for the Emacs 28 development cycle, (after the Emacs 27.1 release in August) that discussion has returned with a vengeance. The themes of this discussion differ somewhat from the last; developers are concerned about making Emacs — an editor with decades of history — seem "modern" to attract new users.
item.author: (By Jonathan CorbetSeptember 25, 2020)

item.title: Pluralsight Editing: Behind the Scenes
item.description:
Support More Content: https://www.patreon.com/codewithsteve https://www.buymeacoffee.com/stevejgordon
In this video, I show the editing process I follow when creating a clip for a Pluralsight module. In this example, I use Camtasia to edit together the audio and video for the first clip for my upcoming course "Implementing Cross-Cutting Concerns for ASP.NET Core Microservices".
Pluralsight Content: https://app.pluralsight.com/profile/author/steve-gordon Twitter: @stevejgordon Web: stevejgordon.co.uk
#aspnetcore #dotnet #behindthescenes #training
item.author: (Code With Steve)

item.title: Bypassing Android MDM using Electromagnetic Fault Injection by a Gas Lighter for $1.5
item.description: This blog talks about how we bypassed the android manufacturer implemented firmware based MDM solution using nothing but a 1.5$ gas lighter and some patience.

item.description: I made these six doodles. A neural network guessed 6 of them correctly. How many of yours can it guess?

item.title: ML.NET September Updates | .NET Blog
item.description: ML.NET is an open-source, cross-platform machine learning framework for .NET developers. It enables integrating machine learning into your .NET apps without requiring you to leave the .NET ecosystem or even have a background in ML or data science. ML.NET provides tooling (Model Builder UI in Visual Studio and the cross platform ML.NET CLI) that automatically trains custom machine learning models for you based on your scenario and data.
item.author: (Bri Achtman Program Manager, .NET Follow)

item.title: Desktop Community Standup - Sept 24th 2020 - Open source development for WinForms
item.description:
In this episode of Desktop Community Standup you will meet some of our key OSS contributors and the WinForms team members working with public PRs. We will talk about the process of submitting, reviewing and accepting PRs and other nuances of OSS development.
Community Links: https://www.theurlist.com/desktop-standup-2020-09-24
Featuring: Olia Gavrysh (@oliagavrysh), Igor Velikorossov (@IgorRussKie), Hugh Bellamy, Tobias Käs
item.author: (.NET Foundation)
